intro: Rondeletia inermis var. dumosa, commonly known as the woolly rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and clusters of small, fragrant pink or red flowers. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a popular choice for botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
